text: Vehicle Rental Frequently Asked Questions
label: HH1

text: How does the Car Rental Program work?  Through a joint agreement with the Western States
label: HH1

text: Contracting Alliance, the State has secured discounted, contract rates with Enterprise Rent a Car, National
label: TITLE

text: Car Rental (Price Agreement No 9950) and Hertz Rent a Car (Price Agreement No. 9949).   The Price
label: BODY

text: Agreement’s contains the account code that must be given to the reservation clerks in order to guarantee the
label: BODY

text: state rates.  Enterprise, Hertz and National has provided our employees a variety of payment options.
label: BODY

text: Note: When renting a car from Enterprise, Hertz or National, be sure to inform them of the State’s
label: BODY

text: Corporate Number. This number will give the Enterprise, Hertz or National location you are renting from
label: BODY

text: all of the information related to the States contract pertaining to rental rates, insurance requirements and
label: BODY

text: other information.  No non-state employees may rent vehicles using these agreements.
label: BODY

text: Who can rent and operate vehicles under the State Price Agreements for vehicle rental services?
label: HH1

text: Any State Employee or Agent of the State may operate the vehicles. There is sometimes confusion whether
label: BODY

text: or not non-state employees can operate the vehicles provided under the Enterprise/National and Hertz Price
label: BODY

text: Agreements.    When ever a vehicle is rented by the state, that rental vehicle falls under the same rules and
label: BODY

text: statutes that apply to state owned vehicles. They are as follows:
label: BODY

text: Agent means:  A person or legal entity appointed in writing by a State agency to perform specific work.  An
label: BODY

text: agent is not an independent contractor.  Agents, paid or unpaid, are subject to the direction and control of
label: BODY

text: the agency.  An agency may not call people “agents” for the primary purpose of justifying their
label: BODY

text: transportation in a State vehicle.
label: BODY

text: Employee means: A person employed by the State of Oregon to do State business for whom the State
label: BODY

text: withholds income tax, provides workers compensation coverage, and pays the workers’ compensation
label: BODY

text: hour-tax.  Under this definition, workers provided by a temporary employment services agency and
label: BODY

text: Department of Corrections inmates are not employees.
label: BODY

text: Vehicle use and storage:  No person shall drive, operate or use, authorize or permit any person to drive,
label: BODY

text: operate or use any motor vehicle as defined in ORS 283.305 for any purpose except for Official State
label: BODY

text: business as defined in ORS 283.305 and by the rules of the Oregon Department of Administrative Services.
label: BODY

text: In other words, when reserving a vehicle that is to be operated by a non-state employee, you need to ask the
label: BODY

text: question whether that person would be allowed to operate a state owned vehicle as an agent or employee as
label: BODY

text: defined above.  If the answer is no, then that person should NOT be driving a vehicle under these price
label: BODY

text: agreements.   The Price Agreements state that the "traveler" is a person who is authorized to travel by a
label: BODY

text: participant, however, per ORS 283.305, the Traveler must fall into either the Agent or Employee
label: BODY

text: definition.   No other individuals are authorized to operate the vehicles under our Price Agreements with
label: BODY

text: Enterprise/National and Hertz.
label: BODY

text: The primary reason is the liability involved for the person driving the vehicle, the Contractor and the State.
label: BODY

text: Our Price Agreements include full damage and liability insurance coverage and if a person was involved in
label: BODY

text: an accident operating a rental vehicle, and it was discovered that the person was not a state employee or
label: BODY

text: agent of the state, the state could ultimately end up being responsible for a non-state employee or non-state
label: BODY

text: agent accident.
label: BODY

text: Is it mandatory that I use the Car rental program?  Yes.  If you are in one of Enterprise, Hertz or
label: BODY

text: National cities, you must use the program.  If you are in a city and there is no Enterprise, Hertz or National
label: BODY

text: location there, you may use another provider; just remember to purchase the insurance when renting from
label: BODY

text: another car rental company.
label: BODY

text: Why do I need a credit card when renting a car?  The car rental companies, nationwide, require this of
label: BODY

text: ALL customers.   This is for their protection when renting a car to an individual.  However, Enterprise,
label: BODY

text: Hertz or National will provide agencies that have a documented need with agency direct billing accounts.
label: BODY

text: All charges are accumulated and billed to the agency’s account.  In this case, a credit card will not be
label: BODY

text: required as Enterprise, Hertz or National has the agency’s account information on file.
label: BODY

text: Do I need to buy the extra insurance when renting a car?  NO. Enterprise, Hertz or National contract
label: BODY

text: covers ALL damage occurred while using the car rental contract.  Also, the State’s insurance will cover any
label: BODY

text: leased or rented vehicle operated by State Employees while on official business.
label: BODY

text: What is the insurance coverage for renting cars in Foreign Countries?  The Insurance coverage the
label: HH1

text: State of Oregon provides for car rentals in foreign countries varies from country to country.  Please call
label: BODY

text: DAS Risk Management at (503) 378-5515 to verify the type of coverage's that are available for the
label: BODY

text: countries you are traveling to and to determine if you will need to purchase additional insurance from the
label: BODY

text: car rental company.
label: BODY

text: What is the mileage limit under the Car rental program?  Unlimited miles although you must pickup
label: BODY

text: and drop off the car at the same location.  Usually the airport you flew into.
label: BODY

text: What if I need to drop the car off at a different location?  You can do a one way rental program, but
label: BODY

text: you will be charged a per mileage charge from the origin point to the destination. There are select cities
label: BODY

text: where no one-way charges are provided, please review the contract for these cities. A 7 day advanced
label: BODY

text: reservation is required to do this.  It is critical that you get the 7 day reservation in, it will reduce the per
label: BODY

text: mileage fee between the two locations.
label: BODY

text: Do I need to be over 25 to rent a Car?  NO The State contact allows drivers 18 and older to rent a
label: BODY

text: vehicle.
label: BODY

text: Car Rental Confirmation Numbers.  It is recommended that you take the Car Rental Confirmation
label: HH1

text: Number with you when you are going to pick up the rental.  This will expedite the rental process.
label: BODY

text: Please walk around vehicle before departing from rental location.  If there are any
label: HH1

text: marks/scratches/damage on vehicle please bring to the counters attention and have them sign off on it.
label: BODY

text: I need to rent a car, who do I call to make a reservation?   You can either call Enterprise, Hertz or
label: BODY

text: National or the States Travel Contractor to make the reservation.
label: BODY

text: Updated 04/06/2010
label: HH1
